reviews.review_text: a failed attempt to remake the wonderful Theme hospital , but it couldn't capture anything and it is really dull ,with terrible sense of humor and game mechanics and a silly story that has nothing to do with the game it self . who said that a sim should have a story ?
Camera angle could be alot better, Theme Hospital is alot better
Enjoyable game but not much of a challenge, you hardly get any patients in your hospital. Would like to see a mix of this and Theme Hospital.
This game its easy, short, and boring.   All levels are the same.  Characters are a little funny thats all.

It's not Theme Hospital but it tries hard to be and succeeds mostly. So far I am on Season 3 Episode 3 and am enjoying it in story mode. It's not nearly as hard as Theme Hospital is. However the only thing I can 100% guarantee you will want to do is turn off the sound. When they talk it's the Sims gibberish and it just repeats over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over...  The graphics are not quite up there with Theme Hospital either but that is because Theme Hospital was Sprites while this went with a very early 3d model engine. So the 3d models are not nearly as detailed or look as good as the sprites do.  Overall I am quite enjoying my time with it. Is it the classic that Theme Hospital is? Nope. But it's a fun little romp through a soap opera Theme Hospital wannabe.

Hospital Tycoon is not as good as the 10 year older Theme Hospital.  The story mode has an awfully written story. It is supposed to be made like a drama, but the whole story arc is shallow and just bad. The graphics are the strongest point of this game, despite weird animations.  There are some crucial programming errors like pathing problems (Receptionists not doing their job and patients dying in the rest room) and script errors in the story, where it is impossible to finish a level after missing an instruction.  There are no graphs at all, just some basic stats listed for your staff. This game should not even be named a Tycoon game.

Eh, this is what i would call the BAD HD, steam port, for theme hospital, i'd recommend getting the original, Theme Hospital. I wish there were a type of tutorial, i wish you could zoom further out, I'd like it to have a simpler User Interface. 6/10.

One of the most hateful games I have played in a long time. The interface is rubbish, the theme is annoying and the hospitals you manage are all the same but without any continuity (you build the same things over and over every level). I wouldn't wish this game on anybody!  Thankyou Steam for letting me remove it permenantly from my Library!
It's more or less a reboot of 'Theme Hospital', right down to the dry British 'humour'. But it's still a solid game.
Seems like an ok game, you are basically Cuddy instead of House - just wish i could turn off the annoying 'The Sims' voices.

I honestly adore tycoon and simulation games. I had a spare couple dollars and this was on sale a little while back so why not try it? Well... This is the only review I have written so far.  I have music playing, and the noises the receptionist or whatever she is was still annoying me. I just turned the sound off and that wasn’t an issue any more.  The thing that gets me about this game was the main story mode. Sexy male ab workout guy can’t marry the nurse because of his dedication to the job. What compelled them to do something like that in a tycoon game? It is just extremely awkward especially for this kind of game.  On a side note, I wish some of this stuff was cured in one doctor visit.

a bad attempt at remaking the classic hospital tycoon. cumbersome interface, boring gameplay.

I got this game for a buck and some change. After accepting that cartoon-styled graphics and the cheesy humor, I felt like the game had more depth than I had originally bargained for. I played for a little over an hour to get the feel for the game. In terms of playability, the game is okay. Even with fast-forward it felt like more waiting time than necessary. The objectives don't seem to change very drastically, just a lot of 'build this room, build machines, hire staff, decorate, repeat.' As a side note, the camera angles are the reason I stopped playing when I did.  It's not a horrible game, but I'd feel cheated if I paid more than a buck for it.
